evaluation_table.original_sap_text: EOT... will not be summarized in visit-based tables
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Data collected at the EOT visit will be mapped to the appropriate cycle window
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP explicitly excludes EOT from visit-based summaries by default. Generated SAP explicitly maps EOT to cycle windows for inclusion.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: unscheduled visit will not be summarized in visit-based tables
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Unscheduled visits... will be included... if it is the closest record to the target day
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP explicitly excludes unscheduled visits from visit-based summaries. Generated SAP includes them if they fall within windows.
Generated SAP provides specific software version where Original was silent. This is acceptable extra detail.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: stratified by country, sex... disease status... ECOG
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: stratification factors: sex... disease status... ECOG... Country will be included as a covariate
evaluation_table.protocol_text: stratified by country, sex... disease status... ECOG
evaluation_table.reasoning: While Generated SAP distinguishes Country as a covariate rather than a randomization stratification factor in the analysis section, Original SAP also specifies using Country as a covariate in the logistic regression model. The analytical approach matches.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Patients will be assigned to treatment groups based on treatment actually received
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Patients will be assigned to treatment groups based on treatment actually received
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP matches Protocol's general rule. Original SAP had a specific tie-breaker rule for mixed treatment cases which Generated SAP omits, but this is not a direct contradiction of the Protocol.

extra_information_flagged.detail: Generated SAP specifies software version where Original was silent.

issues.original_sap_text: EOT... will not be summarized in visit-based tables
issues.generated_sap_text: Data collected at the EOT visit will be mapped to the appropriate cycle window
issues.description: Original SAP excludes EOT from visit summaries by default; Generated SAP maps it to cycles.
issues.reasoning: Direct conflict in default handling of EOT data.

issues.original_sap_text: unscheduled visit will not be summarized in visit-based tables
issues.generated_sap_text: Unscheduled visits... will be included... if it is the closest record to the target day
issues.description: Original SAP excludes unscheduled visits by default; Generated SAP includes them if closest to target.
issues.reasoning: Direct conflict in default handling of unscheduled visit data.

reasoning: The Generated SAP is generally consistent with the Original SAP in terms of core methodology (populations, endpoints, primary analysis method). However, there are two notable contradictions regarding the handling of EOT and Unscheduled visits in summaries (Original excludes, Generated maps/includes). Additionally, the Sample Size calculation, which is a required element present in the Protocol, is missing from the Generated SAP. The ITT definition in the Generated SAP correctly matches the Protocol, whereas the Original SAP had added an extra constraint ('successfully screened'), so this difference is actually a correction. The missing formatting/precision rules are acceptable differences.
summary: The Generated SAP correctly defines populations and primary analysis methods, aligning well with the Protocol. However, it contradicts the Original SAP's specific instructions for handling EOT and unscheduled visits in summaries and omits the required Sample Size calculation.
